dtd_sBF_MbhaNBg8R5nKOA.text: I give it only two because, first I know there busy but services was badThen we had a whole fish it has taken about 30 min. Fish had no flavor and the sauce just put on plate. It was bland Shrimp cooked where no flavorAnyway you can give it a try but I'm not sure if I will be back

UvYOKFTnxE-1OmeieDEB5g.text: Chilli crab was cheap $48 for 800g, prawn fried rice was bland and the satay chicken wasn't great it was deep fried chicken with nutty sauce. Overall chilli crab was cheap and enjoyable/messy will probably come back just for the crab and fried bread and maybe try something else from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Satay chicken
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Messy chilli crab

M9iJIMLmrgGHk4fWWz7utg.text: Very tasty food, service left a bit to be desired and I'm annoyed I paid expecting change and it didn't come. Could I have said something? Absolutely. But lesson learnt. Still, tasty food and somewhere to sit and smash a Tiger or two.

4GdeWLOtp8wLOxbkG_SFoA.text: Those who love long waits and inattentive service would disagree with my rating, but those who have a life and don't enjoy waiting around unnecessarily for their lukewarm dishes might think my two star rating to be a bit generous.We arrived on the eve of my mom's birthday, hoping for a nice steamed fish among other items.  We ordered only 3 dishes.  The first dish took 45 minutes to arrive, even after asking our server twice on the status.  The next dish took another 20 minutes.  Our food was lukewarm at best.  Finally, we had enough and cancelled the third dish and settled the bill.  Hungrily, we set our eyes on the row of restaurants on nearby Smith Street, and discovered there that even the street's simple food stalls tasted better at half the price and a fraction of the wait of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant.If you're looking for fantastic seafood, go to Jumbo Seafood at Clark Quay.  Check out their reviews, and it'll be a done deal.

RI7-wSwEzbS6Bt-_M4u-WA.text: Wait staff is very prompt and friendly and the food is wonderful. I prefer the open air atmosphere so this is home to me when in Sing. On rainy days no better place to enjoy a Tiger beer and watch the crowd.

iyLJvHRXL1Zk8joMHypuBg.text: Went for a Saturday afternoon cocktail, well 633ml tiger beer that was ice cold and less then $8 SGD, good by Singapore standards. I did not try the chili or pepper crab this trip but will be back.

Xw8CcQY_CTjfYkTTDLQVkg.text: This was my first crab dish in Singapore.  Some friends swore by chili crab, others black pepper crab.  How to do? Chinatown advertises the same quality of fresh Sri Lankan mud crab as Long Beach, Jumbo, etc. but at half the price (and about half the size). This, way I was able to order both the black pepper and chili crab.  Overall, I thought the finished dish did not due justice to the quality of the crab.  I'm not a big fan of pepper, and found the black pepper crab had too strong of a pepper flavor.  The chili crab was too sweet.  I would probably give a five star had I ordered the butter garlic crab.  Not sure if there flavor is up to par or not, but the excellent quality of the crab and affordability alone earn Chinatown seafood a 4 star, considering my ignorance on what this dish is supposed to taste like.

WhDFpbDmPOQ9KsJeazUU7g.text: I've been here a number of times. They have a prime location in Chinatown hence the one star. Here are reasons NOT to go here:- You can have the same food for 1/3 of the price in other coffee shops (the restaurants with the plastic chairs) around singapore. Therefore, i classify this a tourist trap. Note: I'm living in singapore 2.5 years.- twice I've asked to sit here just to have a beer and people watch. They refuse cos they want to clean your wallet of every cent purchasing their over priced average food.- when I did decide to go in ( in the past I will not go in again) I found the staff extremely rude. - there is one staff lady who is not fit to be a waitress. I've seen her shout at people and I've been victim to her shouting too. Please read the other reviews I've read them all and many mention this rude employee.- I've had 1 meal here. If your idea of a good night's meal is to suffer verbal abuse then please disregard my review- it's a pity that such a crappy, rude and over priced place can take such a prime spot in Chinatown singapore. I hope in the future a nicer place will replace this restaurant. Then, myself and family can enjoy a rest there after walking through Chinatown

YNeFbMnbCxPX09czzrg9QA.text: Decent place with a fast service. Great selection of different variety of foods.Pretty tasty with the outside seating and the few over the Chinatown Heritage Center.Really worth a try in the center of the Chinatown.Will be back.

32b3M2y2MjP9LGwzEkSSiQ.text: 0 Stars if i could give it. As a local (who has lived overseas for many years) this place is a joke. Mediocre food with extremely rude staff. The waitress was practically chasing away locals (me) and could barely speak english. What is disgrace to singapore culture. Tourist if you want to enjoy good food and experience the singapore culture...go to wast coast lagoon or even newton food center. Don't waste your time at this place.

tkImjatt1P69ZHOS7YjScA.text: It's a tourist trap that is ok-- the menu offers a pretty wide variety of dishes, including crocodile meat-- (my first time trying it!)  My husband tried the chili crab for the first time, which was good, but honestly we couldn't compare to anything else, so the jury is still out.Since it's situation in the heart of Chinatown, just a block from the MRT, it's easy to get to and an easy spot for tourists to gather. The only reason I was there was because my husband's colleagues decided to go there for beer. They drank a lot of it. In fact, they ordered several buckets of large bottles of Tiger beer that the waitress kept filling, so no one actually knew how much they drank! (good business strategy for the restaurant)My thought- if you happen to be in Chinatown and get hungry, this place is better than Burger King :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. It's located right across the street from the Chinese historic center.
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Crocodile meat in a bean sauce

Lcn9MNpnorEtRmSHc1SiLQ.text: This is the best place for Chili Crab in Singapore (at least for me). I have tried the other famous place called No Signboard, i just didn't like their chili crab which has a lot egg yolk inside(but i do like their white pepper crab: pls read my review about them). I know i've been told a lot other places which is far north and in the HDB area, i just never got a chance to try them while i was there. But this one located in Chinatown is good/great enough for a night out, there are many bars' pubs nearby. Easy!!It is a bit touristy, but who cares!! you got the best spot for people watching and a big pint of beer cost only $8？I've been craving for their chili crab ever since i left Singapore sooooo much :(

tNOi6Pd72QX6_ks4oVzgEA.text: Crab meat fried rice was SGD 12.5 but little meat. Compared to SGD 16.5 for Nanas green tea's udon, this is not worth it. Also I had chillie crab, it is tasty, costing me SGD 47 for a crab. To say more, this restaurant and food here are clean while located in Chinatown (not so hygienic community) So if you stay in Chinatown and is suddenly hungry at night, this might be it - late opening hours, clean well-cooked food, fair price. I might come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

r5SZp-vLfuc_JsIia0fEtQ.text: Good selections on food.Good chili crab.Ok price.Ok serving size.Ok service. Overall above average.Very good experience!

PuLcCgz7z8ePv4mAP_vfkw.text: We made our way to China Town for the first time and this placed jumped out at us as somewhere to stop for a light bite to eat. Not really because we thought the food would be amazing. More for the people watching opportunity and the big beer fridges. Staff were very friendly. They were really good at talking to our young nephew and made us feel very welcome. Food was as we imagined it to be. Sweet sour pork and scechuan beef were both ok. The noodles and rice was fine to. I am sure locals don't go here, as it is probably a tourist trap. But for us at that moment it was the right place and the food was decent. Plus the beer was cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

g0bEyBfG5AdKItEC9ALhsQ.text: My business colleague and I ate here on our last night in Singapore. Great Service, very good food at a reasonable price. We shared four appetizers and 3 633ml beers for S$84. This would have been double the price by the Orchard Road hotels. Take a cab and go to Chinatown. Eat here in a fun setting and buy some trinkets to take home to the family. I will not wait until the last night to eat here the next time.

5Okn1_kHnFtickTnQPAyqA.text: We were hungry and knew we were coming into a tourist trap.  Yet, we couldn't move another step because we just wanted to eat.There I sat thinking we were in for it.We were in for it.  Okay food for food we didn't think was worth it's price.Ended up being around $65 per person.We were being stupid and we knew it.  Of all the places to eat in Chinatown, don't come here.Service was also very slow in all three of our opinions.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

XTy5sawadZlAKVdY9xiSjA.text: Great for a quick bite to eat before exploring the rest of Singapore. While I didn't have the Chili Crab here (I saved that experience for Jumbo), the food that was ordered was very good. Prawns. Prawns. Prawns. In a spring roll. Fried. With noodles. They were all very  tasty and washed down with a cold Tiger beer on a hot day. The service was fast and English Premier League football was on, so I was able to catch up what I missed from the day before. Great start to a day (having early brunch) if you ask me. The location was very easy to find. Right in the middle of Chinatown on a busy corner, you kind of just run into it. But like Christopher Columbus, he wasn't exactly looking for America but that turned out well for all parties involved (except the Natives). Tasty food. Cold Beer. Quick service. Great location.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Spring rolls. Fried prawns. Noodles with prawns. Tiger beer.

eBMagU5wFN1fZINmfl1iVw.text: After walking through the streets of Chinatown we were very happy that we stumbled across this place - we ended up coming back twice! Please note, we kept our order very simple as we were coming for a snack vs. a meal. The Tiger beer was ice cold, as were the bottled waters. Much needed on a hot day. The crispy prawn rolls were delicious (got them twice) and the satay was tasty, too. Recommend for a nice break and recharge.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Crispy prawn rolls - yum.

vysaasKdcYL0nolaSkBtpQ.text: I had the chili crab of course! It was expensive $48/800g, but very delicious. I tried it with the traditional fried bun, $3/6pcs. The place was hopping so they must be something right. The waitstaff was very attentive, filling up your beers, grabbing extra napkins for the insanely messy dish etc. They charged me 30cents for a second wet towel though, which I thought was pretty annoying considering my bill $76 for one person. The Tiger beer was cold and cheap. I like the hustle bustle outside setting too. The chili crab was very yummy. The sauce was thick and sweet and a little spicy. I've never had it before so I'm no connoisseur but it tasted they way I imagined it would. I'd go here again and order something else.

YiFND_urXhocK0BBU2PGmw.text: Also known as Ba Dao Guan (per receipt), this place draws ALOT of customers during the usual foot traffic hours; mostly tourists it felt like but also locals.Located on a busy corner, this spacious cafe-style spot drew me in thanks to one of the [modest fanservice] Tiger beer ladies walking around. Yeah, gimme one of those, please, thanks! Mmmm. Then waitress comes by and I just get the S'pore vermicelli noodles. Pretty good.It's just a big, functional, solid place for modest fixin's with a decent touristy atmosphere open to the outside. :)PS. Watch out for soft spots in the wooden raised floor. My spot near the beer coolers wobbled a bit when people walked near my table.

gv7Q7L946uNNpr50O2i6LA.text: Amazing pork dumplings....... Had to order another round. Also a great place to people watch!

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

fObNV5wKrFb1smpBMIHNJw.text: Maybe I just don't know anything about good chilli crab, but I really liked the crab here! It's expensive compared to most food, but I think it's affordable compared to chilli crab elsewhere. The sauce was super flavorful - I couldn't get enough of it! And they give you cute bibs because the crab's so messy to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. chilli crab!

S8j2JDJ07olcEJAwMM7OyA.text: Update...The shrimps were either steamed too long or from frozen stock...Have to agree with Phillip and Tommy...we came early around 6 pm for dinner, ordered the large (1.2kg) chili crab (S$72) stream garlic shrimp, fried rice, Singapore rice noodles, scallops and broccoli, everything came luke warm...just wondering if it's a Singapore thing... by the way, each fish came about 5-10 min apart, the shrimp has not arrived after 20 min from the last dish... it's 6:57pm still waiting for the shrimp!

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore. Finally...
Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore

nkPNT3yaOnYeGa0QIWPRkg.text: We had 7 people for dinner and all of us were impressed!   We sat in the AC part which was nice.  The Singapore noodles and stir fried green beans were so good that we reordered them!Chili crab was very good and enjoyed by all!

rtNRM4RQOsxTlI1pZQ1MLQ.text: Crocodile in black bean sauce. Whats that you say now? Yes, yes it was.   This place is in the middle of Chinatown Singapore. I would like y'all to please remember that Im a tourist, I did kind of touristy things.Ive gotta say I loved the nonchalance about this place.  Sit down, order 500ml Tiger beer. You WILL need an ice bucket for that. Singapore only has one season. Sweaty.  A stein like mug. That beer is 5 Singapore bucks. If youre Aussie that about $4.80? how can you go wrong. We went to this venue twice. The first time we sat down because we were absolutely beat from the humid humid weather in Singapore and needed a cold one.  We didn't eat, but we met a local guy who claimed to own the clothes shop diagonally opposite. Thats the thing about this place, it's kind of like a beer garden, but in a really busy thoroughfare, you can easily meet people. Ex-pats and locals alike. We did our best to blend in, but somehow my Tattoos were always either pitch point for the cunning sales people of the shops here, or a convo point for the local regulars.The food: There was the obligatory fish tanks full of crabs and fish.  We ordered Scallops with garlic and broccoli and the Crocodile. also special fried rice which to be frank was one of the best Ive had. period.  Very cheap, Very tasty. I would go there again in a heartbeat it I was ever in town again. Dont be put off by the very casual aspect of this place. I just considered it like a beer garden pub with a very busy frontage.

photos.caption: Photo of Chinatown Seafood Restaurant - Singapore, Singapore
